nodes.name: Validate response

options.systemPromptTemplate:
You are a highly intelligent and accurate sentiment analyzer. Analyze the sentiment of the provided text. Categorize it into one of the following: {categories}. Use the provided formatting instructions. Only output the JSON.

> Evaluate the following customer support response. Give a short JSON answer with a field “quality”: “pass” or “fail”. Only return “pass” if the response:

1. Acknowledges both the broken keyboard and the late delivery  
2. Uses a polite and empathetic tone  
3. Offers a clear resolution or next step (like refund, replacement, or contact support)

nodes.notes: This sentimentAnalysis node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Generate response

messageValues.message: =You’re an AI assistant replying to a customer who is upset about a faulty product and late delivery. The customer uses sarcasm and is vague. Write a short, polite response, offering help.

nodes.notes: This chainLlm node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
### Customer complaint - example

I really *love* waiting two weeks just to get a keyboard that doesn’t even work. Great job. Any chance I could actually use the thing I paid for sometime this month?

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content: Defines the LLM node by index which should be used.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content: Dynamically connects the LLM by the index provided in the previous node.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content: Check if LangChain Code Node ran into error. _Currently only supports error output from main Node_

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content: Generates a polite answer based on the customers complaint.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note5

parameters.content: Analyses the generated answer by certain criteria

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note6

parameters.content: Increases the index to choose the next available LLM on the next run

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Dynamically switch between LLMs Template

## Overview
Automated workflow: Dynamically switch between LLMs Template. This workflow integrates 10 different services: stickyNote, code, chainLlm, set, stopAndError. It contains 26 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 26
- **Node Types**: 10
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **When chat message received**: chatTrigger
- **Switch Model**: code
- **Set LLM index**: set
- **Increase LLM index**: set
- **No Operation, do nothing**: noOp
- **Check for expected error**: if
- **Loop finished without results**: set
- **Unexpected error**: set
- **Return result**: set
- **OpenAI 4o-mini**: lmChatOpenAi
- ... and 16 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
